description.narrative: Communities, schools and health centres have access to sufficient safe water in targeted rural community in the Dry Zone, conflict effected children and women in Mon and Kayin States.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Myanmar (Responding to Emergencies)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Myanmar 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Myanmar Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, schools and health centres have access to sufficient safe water in targeted rural community in the Dry Zone, conflict effected children and women in Mon and Kayin States.

description.narrative: 84,147 people (51 percent women) from 65 villages have access to basic water services through community managed water metering systems in dry zone, Rakhine and Kayin. 22,622 students (51 percent girls) in 140 schools of 15 townships in Kayin, Kachin, Kayah and Chin States have access improved WASH facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/12/2017

title.narrative: Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of people living in water safe communities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of villages using improved sources of drinking water in targeted townships
Number of schools that practice daily group handwashing in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes.
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities that meet national standards have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
